text.content: GOING TO THE SWIMMING POOL
Juan and his sister Maria are excited because it's a hot day in their neighborhood.
They put on their swimsuits and grab their towels.
Their mom gives them a backpack with water and snacks.
The pool is small but clean, and it's their favorite place to cool off.
Juan jumps into the water first, and Maria follows.
They play with a ball and laugh a lot.
When they're tired, they rest on the deck chairs.
Their cousin Pedro joins them and splashes water around.
At home, they drink juice and rest on the sofa.
MY FRIEND PICKS ME UP IN A BIKE
Today, my friend Camilo is picking me up on his bike.
He lives three blocks away, so I wait in front of my house.
When I see him, I put on my helmet and climb onto the seat behind him.
Camilo pedals fast, and the wind blows through my hair.
We pass by shops, people walking their dogs, and a small park.
On the way, Camilo greets the shopkeeper who sells sandwiches.
He tells me there's a special discount today, so I buy one later.
We arrive at the basketball court, where other friends are waiting.
We play until it's late afternoon.
After, we ride to the shop to buy chips and soda.
Before sunset, Camilo gives me a ride back home.
MY NEW PET
My family and I are adopting a dog from the shelter.
We chose a friendly puppy with brown fur and white paws.
When we arrive, the volunteers show us his picture and tell us his name is Bruno.
I hold Bruno's paw, and he wags his tail.
We fill out some forms and take him to our home.
At home, Bruno explores the yard.
He sniffs the flowers and chases a butterfly.
We give him a toy and some treats.
Later, I teach him to sit and shake hands.
He learns quickly because he wants to please us.
In the evening, Bruno sleeps in his bed and dreams of running in the park.
Tomorrow, we are going to take Bruno for a walk in the park.
WHO IS MY SUPER HERO
My hero is my older brother, David.
He is taller and stronger than me.
When I was little, David helped me ride my bike without training wheels.
At school, he helps me with my homework every day.
He explains math problems step by step until I understand.
When I feel scared about trying new things, David encourages me to be brave.
He once saved me when a dog chased me near our house.
I look up to his kindness, his patience, and his work ethic.
In our neighborhood, people respect David because he always helps elders.
My brother works hard in a part-time job but still makes time for me.
I want to be like him when I grow up and help others as he does. For now, I admire him and try to make him proud.
CONTROLLING MY CELPHONE TIME
I spend too much time on my phone, and my grades are dropping.
Every morning, I check social media before getting ready.
In class, I sneak my phone under the desk to watch videos.
My teacher noticed, and she told me to leave it in my backpack.
I feel anxious without it, but I want to improve my grades.
I decide to set a daily limit: no more than one hour of screen time after homework.
My mom agrees to help: she hides my charger at night.
At school, I focus on my books and write notes by hand.
After a week, my teacher says she sees more effort. Good job!
I feel proud because I'm doing better in math and English.
My friends notice I'm less distracted, and they ask for study tips. If I succeed, my mom will let me keep my phone.
PLANING MY FUTURE IN LOGISTICS
I need to decide what to study after high_school.
Logistics seems interesting because I like organizing things.
My cousin works in a warehouse, and he says the pay is decent.
I must improve my math skills because it's essential for logistics.
Next month, I am visiting a campus to learn more.
The application process may be competitive, but I'll try my best.
My parents want me to succeed, so they support my decision.
I will attend workshops to prepare for the entrance exam.
By next year, I hope to be accepted into a good program.
This career might open doors to better opportunities for my family.
